pull.title: doc: add `scanblocks` to list of descriptor RPCs
pull.body: This is a tiny documentation follow-up to #23549.

events.message: doc: add `scanblocks` to list of descriptor RPCs

events.body: @kouloumos @aureleoules: Thanks for your quick reviews! :D Took kind of a combination of both of your suggestions.

ACK ff138f9cf11b94bdfa5b16d7d03af93e619842d8

Clean documentation. Clearly explains what `scanblocks` does.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -21,6 +21,7 @@ Supporting RPCs are:
 - `importdescriptors` takes as input descriptors to import into a descriptor wallet
   (since v0.21).
 - `listdescriptors` outputs descriptors imported into a descriptor wallet (since v22).
+- `scanblocks` takes as input descriptors to scan for in blocks (since v25).
comments.body:
```suggestion
- `scanblocks` takes as input descriptors and returns relevant blockhashes (since v25).
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -21,6 +21,7 @@ Supporting RPCs are:
 - `importdescriptors` takes as input descriptors to import into a descriptor wallet
   (since v0.21).
 - `listdescriptors` outputs descriptors imported into a descriptor wallet (since v22).
+- `scanblocks` takes as input descriptors to scan for in blocks (since v25).
comments.body:
just to be consistent with the rest of the RPC's wording, maybe
```suggestion
- `scanblocks` takes as input descriptors to scan for in blocks and reports the relevant blockhashes (since v25).
```
edit: oups @aureleoules beat me to it
